args: The game is afoot, Heinwald!\nIt's time for an investigation!
Surely you jest. Only an idiot would go\noutside when it's raining this heavily.\nIf you wish to investigate, do it yourself.
Seeker of Truth and Curran's Partner\nHeinwald

You do the footwork, and I figure out what
your findings mean. Everyone does the
task best suited to them—that is how
a partnership works, is it not?
You love calling me your partner only\nwhen it suits you. Now stop grumbling\nand let's get going already!
Please calm down, guys. There's no reason\nyou always have to be arguing.
We are calm, {player_name}.\nWe also happen to disagree.
Well, let's put a pin in that for a minute.\nThere's actually something I've been\nmeaning to ask you two for a while.
What made you decide to form a team\nwhen you're both so...different?
A few years ago, I was pursuing a\nheretical mage.
But SOMEONE decided to meddle\nin my investigation—and that is\nwhen it all began...
Hello there. You're an inquisitor, yes?
And you're the mage I've heard so much\nabout! How nice of you to save me the\ntrouble of tracking you down.
I'm a scholar of magic, that much is true.\nBut I'm afraid I'm not the heretical mage\nyou're so busily looking for.
My name is Heinwald, and I do, in fact,\nhave business with your target.
(After introducing himself, he vanished—\nleaving me DEEPLY suspicious of him.)
(To make it even stranger, it turned out\nhe was actually an Alberian noble.)
(As well as a total weirdo who showed\nabsolutely no interest in anything other\nthan magical research.)
(His appearance seemed to spell\nnothing but trouble for me.)
(But I girded my loins and continued my\ninvestigation nonetheless. And then...)
Whew! Well, that was a total pain,\nbut I finally know where he's hiding.
You took a very long time to find\nthis place.
The mage we are searching for is here,\nI take it?
What do you intend to do if he is?
Oh, I have no interest in taking him in—\nor in what happens to him if you do so.\nI just need to check something.
The point is, you and I are not enemies.
I'm not so sure about that. But regardless,\nit's probably safer for me to keep an eye\non you until this mess is settled.
So come with me—and no funny business!
You're very understanding for an inquisitor.\nIt is a fine trait to have.
(In the end, we were able to apprehend\nthe mage and drag him from his hideout.)
It's over! Give it up and come quietly!
And I will be taking THIS, thank you.
Hang on there, sticky fingers.\nWhat's that?
Now to open the ancient pages and...
Well, this was a waste of time.\nSuch a shame.
Return my grimoire to me at once!
You, stop running your mouth.\nAnd YOU, tell me what that book is.
This book has a certain spell written in it.\nOne that your Church would likely find\nmost heretical indeed.
It is an ancient magic that allows the\nwielder to use dragon scales and claws\nto enhance the efficacy of their magic.
But alas, this grimoire is but a shoddy\ncopy of the original; the inscription of\nthe most important part is nonsense.
And how do you know THAT?!
Because I have the correct spell\ncommitted to memory.
I was hoping the text in this copy would be\nolder, but it was all for naught.
Maybe you should take this guy in\nwhile you're at it.
I was just carrying an old book around,\nbut HE'S memorizing heretic spells!
Tell me—how many dragons did you\nsacrifice while researching that spell?
I'll not be lumped into the same category\nas someone who treats their research\nsubjects as expendable tools.
They died noble deaths to aid my research!\nI gave their pathetic lives meani—
Well, my work here is finished,\nso I shall take my leave.
I thought you looked suspicious,\nand now I know for sure.
I may not know your endgame here,\nbut I know a heretic when I see one!
So you ARE intending to lump me in\nwith this pathetic conjurer.
I'm deeply offended. Have you not been\nlistening to a single thing I've said?
True, I cannot pretend to perfectly follow\nthe laws of the Church or kingdom...
But I CAN promise to never sink to the\ndepths of lowlifes who would sacrifice\nliving things in the name of ＂research.＂
You know where to find me, yes?\nI'm not going to hide or run away.
So if you're set on naming me a heretic,\nyou can come for me when you like.
Yes, I found myself faced with a very\ntough choice as an inquisitor.
Would I brand him a heretic as I had\ncountless others before him?
Or would I go against my own rules and\naccept his argument as truth?
That sounds like quite the dilemma.
I spent days racking my brain over what to\ndo—and after finally making up my mind,\nI made my way to his mansion.
Hello, Curran. Are you here to clap me\nin irons and swallow the key?
I've been agonizing over what to do\never since we parted ways.
Not only am I questioning if you are a\nheretic, I'm now questioning what a\nheretic IS in the most general sense!
While you're THIS close to being a heretic,\nyou're not inherently evil.
You just research what interests you\nand don't hurt anyone in the process.
So I'm not going to report you.
I'm honored that an inquisitor\nwould think so highly of me.
However! If I leave you unwatched,\nthere's no telling what trouble you\nmight get up to.
So I'm going to keep you\nright where I can see you.
Still, solving riddles has always been\na hobby of mine, and I did rather enjoy\nour little investigation.
With an inquisitor like you at my side,\nI can see myself stumbling onto even\nmore interesting problems in the future.
If you're treating this as a game,\nI have bad news for you.
Balderdash! I will be fine. Frankly,\nyou should be far more concerned\nwith holding ME back.
I hope you know I'll be\nworking you to the bone.
...So that was the beginning of your\npartnership, was it?
Since then, we've solved all manner\nof mysteries together.
Yep. I do all the thankless hard work of\ngathering information, while he just sits\naround and thinks.

You make my role sound so insignificant.
And yet, you fail to mention all the times
you were without a single lead and
begging for my assistance.
I have NO idea what you're talking about.
Can we please not do this again?\n...Oh, look! The rain stopped.
We've been talking for longer than I knew.\nStill, I guess that means it's time to go.
*sigh* Reluctant as I am, I cannot turn\ndown the prospect of a new mystery.
Your eyes DO light up like a kid\nat Dragonyule whenever you\nfind a new case.
So let's get this show on the road.\nI'm counting on you, partner!
